answers.answer: I suggest you ask a doctor this very specific question, your dad's doctors if possible. This is a board composed of other people with diabetes, not medical professionals.

question: HiMy dad is facing issues with his left leg.56 year old Man located in India.Seems that the blood supply in it isnt well and there is blockages in the veins. He has undergone a bypass surgery for heart in Oct 2009He has undergone amputation of 1 finger on the left leg due to an infection last monthThe diabetic surgeon has suggested an angiography on his leg to determine course of treatementHowever his Creatin level is high. It was 2.0 before the operation and then post surgery rose to 2.8. It is currently 2,.4The wound isnt healing and it is more than a month of surgery.Is there any type of angiography that can be done with this creatin level without the risk of it increasing and causing patient to undergo dyialsis.
title: Help needed. Angiography with creatin at 2.4
